column1: Tupaciguara is a Brazilian municipality located in the west of the state of Minas Gerais. Its population as of 2015 was 25 363 peoples living in a total area of 1
column2: 826 km². The city belongs to the statistical mesoregion of Triângulo Mineiro and Alto Paranaíba and to the statistical microregion of Uberlândia.  It became a municipality in 1911.Tupaciguara is located at an elevation of 865 meters in the rich region known as the Triângulo Mineiro.  It is northwest of Uberlândia and lies on the southern boundary of the Itumbiara reservoir.

column1: The distance to Uberlândia is 69 km; and the distance to Belo Horizonte is 617 km.   Neighboring  municipalities are:   the state of Goiás (N); Araporã (W) ; Monte Alegre de Minas(S); Uberlândia and Araguari(E) The main economic activities are services
column3: and small industries.  The GDP in 2005 was R$208
column14: 000.00 from agriculture.  There were 601 rural producers on 140
column15: 000 hectares of land.  235 farms had tractors.  The main crops were coffee

column1: The social indicators rank it in the top tier of municipalities in the state.
State ranking: 112 out of 853 municipalities as of 2000
Life expectancy: 74 (average of males and females)The highest ranking municipality in Minas Gerais in 2000 was Poços de Caldas with 0.841
column2: while the lowest was Setubinha with 0.568.  Nationally the highest was São Caetano do Sul in São Paulo with 0.919
column3: while the lowest was Setubinha.  In more recent statistics (considering 5
column4: 507 municipalities) Manari in the state of Pernambuco has the lowest rating in the country—0
column5: 467—putting it in last place.There was one hospital with 29 beds in 2005.  Patients with more serious health conditions are taken care of in Uberlândia or Araguari.
